verses.name: 2 Kings 6:5
verses.text: But as one was felling a beam, the axe head fell into the water: and he cried, and said, Alas, master! for it was borrowed.

verses.name: 2 Kings 6:6
verses.text: And the man of God said, Where fell it? And he shewed him the place. And he cut down a stick, and cast it in thither; and the iron did swim.

verses.name: 2 Kings 6:7
verses.text: Therefore said he, Take it up to thee. And he put out his hand, and took it.

verses.name: 2 Kings 6:8
verses.text: Then the king of Syria warred against Israel, and took counsel with his servants, saying, In such and such a place shall be my camp.
